snippet.textDisplay:
Try Rocket Money for free: https://RocketMoney.com/legacygaming

*SMALL CORRECTION* - Raider Tokens are NO LONGER required to upgrade your stash. This change was made at launch and not part of any preview, but we find this to be a great thing removing premium currency from interacting with game systems.
snippet.textOriginal:
Try Rocket Money for free: https://RocketMoney.com/legacygaming

*SMALL CORRECTION* - Raider Tokens are NO LONGER required to upgrade your stash. This change was made at launch and not part of any preview, but we find this to be a great thing removing premium currency from interacting with game systems.

snippet.textDisplay: Craft in-game, bring defibrillators, bring ziplines, roll when falling to negate damage, climb on arc drones and they forget eventually, use smoke grenades while reviving, rubber ducks agro arcs to where they're thrown (useful for getting arcs on enemy team), melee security scanners to avoid noise, upgrade workbenches should be a priority (track their resources)

snippet.textDisplay: Also remember that when using a raider hatch key, the hatch only stays open for so long. One of our teammates went down the raider hatch before my son and I were able to get into the hatch and we had to extract at the public elevator with a Rocketeer chasing us down the entire time. We made it about 650 m with three minutes left on the clock And barely survived. It was fucking crazy. But just remember. When using the raider hatch key make sure all of your teammates are close so you guys can go down at the same time.
snippet.textOriginal: Also remember that when using a raider hatch key, the hatch only stays open for so long. One of our teammates went down the raider hatch before my son and I were able to get into the hatch and we had to extract at the public elevator with a Rocketeer chasing us down the entire time. We made it about 650 m with three minutes left on the clock And barely survived. It was fucking crazy. But just remember. When using the raider hatch key make sure all of your teammates are close so you guys can go down at the same time.

snippet.textDisplay: As a Tarkov vet. The biggest tip I can give new players in the genre is that YOU CAN JUST RUN AWAY! You don't have to fight every fight to the death. If you don't think you can win, drop a smoke and ninja out of there. If you die you lose everything so don't be ashamed to make a tactical retreat.
snippet.textOriginal: As a Tarkov vet. The biggest tip I can give new players in the genre is that YOU CAN JUST RUN AWAY! You don't have to fight every fight to the death. snippet.textDisplay: If you are seeing this before you play for the first time, here is a tip i have. During the tutorial mission at the beginning LOOT everything you can outside the building. After you enter the building and before you get knocked out in the cinematic (sorry for the spoiler) DROP everything that you previously looted on the floor. I dropped to the floor in a separate room just in case. When you awake everything will still be there for you to pick up. Otherwise it will all be gone from your backpack. This will help with some extra cash at the beginning of your journey as there are several items that can be sold outright.
snippet.textOriginal: If you are seeing this before you play for the first time, here is a tip i have. During the tutorial mission at the beginning LOOT everything you can outside the building. After you enter the building and before you get knocked out in the cinematic (sorry for the spoiler) DROP everything that you previously looted on the floor. I dropped to the floor in a separate room just in case. When you awake everything will still be there for you to pick up. Otherwise it will all be gone from your backpack. This will help with some extra cash at the beginning of your journey as there are several items that can be sold outright.

snippet.textDisplay:
"some of the best directional audio" - sorry, what? Its literally the same standard directional audio every other game has, you have a vague understanding where people are and if they are in the room next to you or not if theyre sprinting. For genre-defining audio go play Hunt Showdown. Thats where you actually have good sound.
Shield recharges need plastic as show on screen, not metal as suggested by narration, at least dub correct it post vid? And defib section repeats itself twice after itself. And progress of breaking does not save, the UI has been redone and you start from scratch, at least for containers, didnt check on doors. And very contradicting advice on melee tool - dont waste ammo and swing on Arcs because.. waste meds instead? Dont shoot because you give out position but shoot a camera once cause it beeps? Unless you are making some sort of crouchwalking silencer bushwookie gameplay, you will be heard by others looting and just running around the place if they come close enough. Shooting some on the go as you traverse wont do you much harm unless you already are stepping on people who are in IMMEDIATE vicinity of you, in which case yes, they could ambush you, but then again. Depending on the situation - do you really want your enemy to find yourself with your pants down, half shield and melee tool in had when they open the door to your room? And out the most important "tip" never mentioned - use free loadouts and dont be afraid to lose it. Its free, and you can only go up and get more with it. Dying is an essential aspect of the genre and the game is balanced around the idea of the player dying half the time or so. Getting your game knowledge and battle experience in a fight is more impactful than scrouchwalking for 30 minutes afraid to lose your free loadout and some metal scraps. ALso, if you get a blueprint - just dip. They are rare and are giga valuable early, so its worth leaving immediately upon finding one, if you cant save it in the safe slot.
snippet.textOriginal:
"some of the best directional audio" - sorry, what? Its literally the same standard directional audio every other game has, you have a vague understanding where people are and if they are in the room next to you or not if theyre sprinting. For genre-defining audio go play Hunt Showdown. Thats where you actually have good sound.
Shield recharges need plastic as show on screen, not metal as suggested by narration, at least dub correct it post vid? And defib section repeats itself twice after itself. And progress of breaking does not save, the UI has been redone and you start from scratch, at least for containers, didnt check on doors. And very contradicting advice on melee tool - dont waste ammo and swing on Arcs because.. waste meds instead? Dont shoot because you give out position but shoot a camera once cause it beeps? Unless you are making some sort of crouchwalking silencer bushwookie gameplay, you will be heard by others looting and just running around the place if they come close enough. Shooting some on the go as you traverse wont do you much harm unless you already are stepping on people who are in IMMEDIATE vicinity of you, in which case yes, they could ambush you, but then again. Depending on the situation - do you really want your enemy to find yourself with your pants down, half shield and melee tool in had when they open the door to your room? And out the most important "tip" never mentioned - use free loadouts and dont be afraid to lose it. Its free, and you can only go up and get more with it. Dying is an essential aspect of the genre and the game is balanced around the idea of the player dying half the time or so. Getting your game knowledge and battle experience in a fight is more impactful than scrouchwalking for 30 minutes afraid to lose your free loadout and some metal scraps. ALso, if you get a blueprint - just dip. They are rare and are giga valuable early, so its worth leaving immediately upon finding one, if you cant save it in the safe slot.

snippet.textDisplay: These types of games feel like a rug pull now lmfaoooo. They get hyped up by a bunch of mid streamers who need the extra views and money from Nexon. The actual server slam or beta comes out and the community is split on whether they like it, but the crypto bros are like "don't worry man, it will still be the best thing since sliced bread when it releases. This garbage you're playing is only 1/100th of the game!". Game comes out and it's the same repetitive and boring gameplay, just more of it. The player count will drop off fast for this game as it should. You can tell people are getting paid with their over grandiose titles and prophesy claims about a basic extraction shooter with 3D audio. You can tell the publisher is using a comment bot farm when everyone is a dad with 10 kids and a 70 hour work week or an 80 year grandpa that has never touched a game in their life, but this game gave them hope to keep fighting cancer and talk to their grandkids again. I hope everyone can still get a refund before their respective grace period runs out, unless you are on a PS5 of course lol.
snippet.textOriginal: These types of games feel like a rug pull now lmfaoooo. They get hyped up by a bunch of mid streamers who need the extra views and money from Nexon. The actual server slam or beta comes out and the community is split on whether they like it, but the crypto bros are like "don't worry man, it will still be the best thing since sliced bread when it releases. This garbage you're playing is only 1/100th of the game!". Game comes out and it's the same repetitive and boring gameplay, just more of it. The player count will drop off fast for this game as it should. You can tell people are getting paid with their over grandiose titles and prophesy claims about a basic extraction shooter with 3D audio. You can tell the publisher is using a comment bot farm when everyone is a dad with 10 kids and a 70 hour work week or an 80 year grandpa that has never touched a game in their life, but this game gave them hope to keep fighting cancer and talk to their grandkids again. I hope everyone can still get a refund before their respective grace period runs out, unless you are on a PS5 of course lol.

snippet.textDisplay:
1st match. Got to a location that was really close to the start point. Looted a few containers. Saw a guy in the distance looting a container. Shot him in the back with a full clip of a basic assault rifle. He spun around an killed me with two shotgun blasts.

2nd match. Left the start location and immediatly got spotted by a drone that alerted 2 of the weaker drones got chased to the nearest building whilst dodging their attacks. Got to the building, just about to enter through the door, killed by the 2 weakest robots. 

Time for a smoke i think.
snippet.textOriginal:
1st match. Got to a location that was really close to the start point. Looted a few containers. Saw a guy in the distance looting a container. Shot him in the back with a full clip of a basic assault rifle. He spun around an killed me with two shotgun blasts.

2nd match. Left the start location and immediatly got spotted by a drone that alerted 2 of the weaker drones got chased to the nearest building whilst dodging their attacks. Got to the building, just about to enter through the door, killed by the 2 weakest robots. 

Time for a smoke i think.

snippet.textDisplay: I've found for the best Solo experience, it's best to play on console and turn off Cross-play and avoid the PC players. It makes for a much more enjoyable time where you can actually progress and make some friends to help you battle the tough ARC that attack you. I play on a PS5 Pro on a 75-inch Sony Bravia TV, and it's awesome!!!
snippet.textOriginal: I've found for the best Solo experience, it's best to play on console and turn off Cross-play and avoid the PC players. It makes for a much more enjoyable time where you can actually progress and make some friends to help you battle the tough ARC that attack you. I play on a PS5 Pro on a 75-inch Sony Bravia TV, and it's awesome!!!

snippet.textDisplay: I‚Äôm so disappointed with how PVP this game is. I was hoping for way more PVE runs for the squad. I would have loved a game more focused on taking down Arcs or saving other raiders or teaming up for a big score. As a PVP game I think my entire squad is gunna pass. Our game nights don‚Äôt need to have anything to do with the sweaty try hards sniping us while we are having fun.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am over 200 slots in my stash and have yet to be asked to spend premium on it yet. My next upgrade is over 60k normal money.

Pro Tip: You do NOT have to stay for a long time in your raids. If you top off your backpack in the very first building you get, it's appropriate to *IMMEDIATELY HEAD FOR AN EXIT*. You can always jump right back into another raid. There isn't a penalty for quickly leaving a raid and you'll have the pleasure of getting items from Scrap the Roosters right away.
snippet.textOriginal:
I am over 200 slots in my stash and have yet to be asked to spend premium on it yet. My next upgrade is over 60k normal money.

Pro Tip: You do NOT have to stay for a long time in your raids. If you top off your backpack in the very first building you get, it's appropriate to *IMMEDIATELY HEAD FOR AN EXIT*. You can always jump right back into another raid. There isn't a penalty for quickly leaving a raid and you'll have the pleasure of getting items from Scrap the Roosters right away.

snippet.textDisplay:
Like expected a day in and we already met the first hackers (invisible 100% of the time except for the ARC for some reason).  Still not sold on the PVEVP aspect of the game, like a lot of other people out there i would prefer a toggle to have the PVP option enabled or not (it really adds 0 to the game except for frustation when you and your crew want to explore and do some stuff). 
As for the inventory, you can expand that at last 3 times for ingame currency without the needs for premium, which imho are must haves if you can afford them.

So far after about 12h of gameplay (in group and solo combined) I would give it a 6/10 max but would bump it to a 8 or even 9 if there was a PVE mode only.  (and yes i play it because i got the game for free, if I would have purchased the game i would have asked a refund already)
snippet.textOriginal:
Like expected a day in and we already met the first hackers (invisible 100% of the time except for the ARC for some reason).  Still not sold on the PVEVP aspect of the game, like a lot of other people out there i would prefer a toggle to have the PVP option enabled or not (it really adds 0 to the game except for frustation when you and your crew want to explore and do some stuff). 
As for the inventory, you can expand that at last 3 times for ingame currency without the needs for premium, which imho are must haves if you can afford them.

So far after about 12h of gameplay (in group and solo combined) I would give it a 6/10 max but would bump it to a 8 or even 9 if there was a PVE mode only.  (and yes i play it because i got the game for free, if I would have purchased the game i would have asked a refund already)

snippet.textDisplay:
Try Rocket Money for free: https://RocketMoney.com/legacygaming

*SMALL CORRECTION* - Raider Tokens are NO LONGER required to upgrade your stash. This change was made at launch and not part of any preview, but we find this to be a great thing removing premium currency from interacting with game systems.
